full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 115 of 262 LC8VMAX4 Rodgers - direct 1 A. No. 2 Q. Now, you also mentioned a set of records that you kept separately. What was that? 3 A. My logbook. 4 Q. What's a logbook? 5 A. It just shows you the day you flew, the destination you went to, the flight time that you flew on that. 6 Q. What other information about each flight you piloted did you keep in your logbook? 7 A. I kept passenger names also. 8 Q. Now, did that logbook include every flight that each of Mr. Epstein's planes took or only the flights where you were a crew member? 9 A. It was only the flights that I was a crew member. 10 Q. Over the course of your employment for Mr. Epstein, how often were you away from work? 11 A. On average, about five weeks a year, between vacation and training. 12 Q. I'd now like to ask you to please pull out the binder in front of you and take a look at what's been marked for identification as Government Exhibit 662. 13 A. Okay. I have it. 14 Q. Do you recognize that? 15 A. Yes. 16 Q. What is it? 17 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018977
